headline: Meta unveils 'Meta Compute' initiative to build AI infrastructure
summary: Meta has announced its "Meta Compute" initiative to build artificial intelligence infrastructure and oversee the social media company's global fleet ​of data centers and supplier partnerships in its pursuit of superintelligence.  CEO ‌Mark Zuckerberg said on Monday that the new initiative will be co-led by Meta's head of ‌global infrastructure Santosh Janardhan and Daniel Gross.

headline: Amazon Stock And Meta Lagged In 2025. Here's Why They Are This Analyst's Top 2026 Picks.
summary: Amazon and Meta Platforms both underperformed the S&P 500 last year but the stocks could rally in 2026, Bernstein analysts said Monday.  Amazon and Meta are the firm's top large capitalization technology stock picks.  Bernstein analysts led by Mark Shmulik reiterated an outperform call for shares of both Meta and Amazon in the client note Monday previewing 2026.

headline: Meta names former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chairman
summary: Facebook owner Meta has named Dina Powell McCormick, a former Trump administration adviser and longtime finance executive, as president and vice chairman of the tech giant.  Powell McCormick previously served on Meta's board of directors — where, the company notes, she was “deeply engaged” in accelerating its artificial intelligence push across platforms.  In her new management role, Meta says Powell McCormick will help guide its overall strategy, including the execution of multi-billion-dollar investments.

raw.headline: Meta names former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chairman
raw.summary: Facebook owner Meta has named Dina Powell McCormick, a former Trump administration adviser and longtime finance executive, as president and vice chairman of the tech giant.  Powell McCormick previously served on Meta's board of directors — where, the company notes, she was “deeply engaged” in accelerating its artificial intelligence push across platforms.  In her new management role, Meta says Powell McCormick will help guide its overall strategy, including the execution of multi-billion-dollar investments.

headline: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says
summary: Large technology companies racing to develop artificial intelligence will likely issue between $140 billion and $300 billion of corporate bonds annually in the next three years, according to research by Bank of America.  Debt investors have already shown some signs of fatigue, demanding about one-third of a percentage point of extra yield compared to benchmark Treasuries to buy recent bonds.

raw.headline: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says
raw.summary: Large technology companies racing to develop artificial intelligence will likely issue between $140 billion and $300 billion of corporate bonds annually in the next three years, according to research by Bank of America.  Debt investors have already shown some signs of fatigue, demanding about one-third of a percentage point of extra yield compared to benchmark Treasuries to buy recent bonds.

headline: Meta Needs So Much Capital It Hired Its Own Banker
summary: Meta Platforms  announced on Monday that Dina Powell McCormick, who comes from the worlds of international finance and politics, has become the company’s president and vice chairman.  The move signals Meta won’t slow its enormous artificial-intelligence data center buildout soon.  As a child, McCormick came to America as an Egyptian immigrant who spoke no English.

raw.headline: Meta Needs So Much Capital It Hired Its Own Banker

Discovery (WBD), Meta Platforms (META) hiring former Trump security advisor Dina Powell McCormick as its new president and vice chair, and Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF) plummeting on its fourth quarter guidance. headline: Heard on the Street Friday Recap: Record Highs Again
summary: The unemployment rate ticked down to 4.4%.  The report capped a weak year for hiring and cleared the way for the Federal Reserve to hold rates steady at its late-January meeting.  The White House confirmed that President Trump posted job-market statistics online Thursday that were supposed to remain confidential until the next day.

headline: 'That's A Dumb Thing To Think,' Dave Ramsey Snaps As 29-Year-Old Making $50K Explains Why She Took On A $14K Car Loan With $77K In Debt
summary: A 29-year-old earning $50,000 a year took on a $14,000 car loan while carrying $77,000 in debt. Megan from Indianapolis called "The Ramsey Show," saying she felt "scared and stressed" after laying out a debt load totaling about $77,000 on a $50,000 income. She said she owes about $15,000 in credit cards, $32,000 in student loans, nearly $9,000 in personal debt, roughly $6,000 in back taxes, a medical bill of about $1,000, and $14,000 on a vehicle.
